content: The Act may be cited as the "Commercial Alien Smuggling Elimination Act of 2003" or the "CASE Act of 2003." It introduces a new class of nonimmigrant aliens. Adjustment of status of nonimmigrant to that of person admitted for permanent residence. Section 245(j) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to include provisions for nonimmigrants admitted under specific sections who provide information contributing to alien smuggling investigations or prosecutions. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allow the Secretary of Homeland Security to adjust the status of aliens involved in alien smuggling investigations or prosecutions to that of lawful permanent residents. Additionally, nonimmigrants admitted under specific sections can also have their status adjusted to lawful permanent residents based on recommendations from the Secretary of State or the Attorney General. Additionally, measures can be taken to protect the identity of individuals whose status is adjusted under this provision. SEC. 4. BRINGING IN AND HARBORING CERTAIN ALIENS. Amendment to the Immigration and Nationality Act includes increased criminal penalties for bringing aliens into the US illegally, with potential for up to 10 years additional sentence if certain conditions are met.
